notes: Kuziemko & Werker (2006, JDE) study how US foreign aid responds to recipient-country elections and UN General Assembly voting alignment. The unit of observation is donor-recipient-year (Big 5 UNSC donors x recipients, 1975-2003). The paper uses panel OLS with donor-recipient pair FE, de-meaned by pair, with year or donor-year dummies. Variance is adjusted using 3-way clustering (donor, recipient, year). The key parameter is the interaction of UN voting agreement with election timing (p_unvotes_elecex), which captures whether the US rewards politically aligned countries with more aid around election time.

design_audit.notes: Data de-meaned by donor-recipient pair (within transformation), plus year dummies. Variance adjusted via Cameron-Gelbach-Miller 3-way clustering on donor, recipient, and year. Main table columns I/IV/VII use pair FE + year dummies; columns II/V/VIII use pair FE + donor-year dummies; columns III/VI/IX add macro controls instead of donor-year dummies.

claim_object.outcome_concept: Official Development Assistance (ODA) commitments from Big 5 UNSC members to recipient countries (USD thousands, 2000 constant)
claim_object.treatment_concept: Interaction of UN General Assembly voting alignment (unvotes) with executive election year (i_elecex); the focal coefficient is on p_unvotes_elecex = unvotes * i_elecex
claim_object.estimand_concept: Differential effect of UN voting alignment on ODA during recipient-country election years vs. non-election years, conditional on pair and time FE -- captures whether politically aligned countries receive more aid around elections
claim_object.target_population: All donor-recipient-year observations for Big 5 UNSC permanent members (US, UK, France, Russia/USSR, China) and their recipient countries, 1975-2003

baseline_specs.label: MainTable-ColIV
baseline_specs.notes: Column IV of the main table: pair FE + year dummies, no macro controls. Focal coefficient on p_unvotes_elecex.

baseline_specs.label: MainTable-ColV
baseline_specs.notes: Column V: pair FE + donor-year FE (absorbs all donor-year-level variation). Stricter FE structure.

baseline_specs.label: MainTable-ColVI
baseline_specs.notes: Column VI: pair FE + macro controls (no year/donor-year dummies, relies on controls to capture time trends).

functional_form_policy.notes: The sensitivity file tests log(ODA) as an alternative outcome. When using log ODA, macro controls (pop, gdp2000, etc.) are also logged.

constraints.notes: Macro controls are: pop, gdp2000, pop_donor, gdp2000_donor. These are used as a block (all or none) in the paper. The paper does not use subsets of controls. FE structure varies between {pair+year}, {pair+donor_year}, and {pair+controls}.

canonical.notes: Cameron-Gelbach-Miller 3-way clustering on donor, recipient, and year. This is the paper's baseline inference method (mwc_3way function).

variants.notes: Cluster at the donor-recipient pair level (single-way).
Cluster at the recipient level only.
Two-way clustering on donor and recipient (dropping year dimension).

budgets.notes: Larger budget reflecting the rich specification space. The paper explores many FE structures, treatment decompositions, sample restrictions, and functional forms across the main and sensitivity analyses.

sampling.notes: Only 4 macro controls used as a block, so exhaustive enumeration of LOO and block variations is trivial. Main combinatorial axis is the cross of {FE structure} x {treatment decomposition} x {sample} x {outcome form}.

diagnostics_plan.notes: Check whether elections are trending over time (the paper notes a weak positive trend in election frequency).
